Lastly, edit your record and paste the address of the Wallet you want to use with the Subdomain.

Then click "Confirm" down below. This will be the 3rd and final transaction. In total, with current gas, this should cost $30 ish USD to set up. https://t.co/7ajO9YlYgF

Once everything is successful, disconnect from ENS, then connect it with the wallet w/ the address you just sent it to (i.e your L3dger wallet etc).

Send a little bit of ETH to that wallet, this one should be around the same price as the last two actions ($10 USD at 30 Gwei) https://t.co/Fo7nsIT6tB

click on the Subdomain, then edit the â€œControllerâ€ field to the address you want it to redirect to, then press â€œSetâ€ 

I believe this will also charge a gas fee at around the same price. https://t.co/qal3GZImrH

click on the .eth name you want to add a subdomain, go to the Subdomains tab, then click Add Subdomain.

This will charge a gas fee (around $10 USD rn) https://t.co/l6NNYIVmVU

subdomains of your .eth username lets you use variants of it for multiple addresses 

super helpful if you own multiple wallets, or if you want to give one to someone you know

gas is super low rn so this can all be done for under $50 ea

so in these cases, connecting with L*dger Live and ğŸ¦Š with L*dger are better if you want to have a safer web3 experience than just ğŸ¦Š by itself

the downside is that this clearly isn't meant for a wallet used for trading.

there's also a cost in activating the Vault + adding Guardians. Adding a Guardian that isn't your number or email will cost you $20-$30 each in gas fees and activating the Vault will be around $60-$80
Because multiple devices/people are needed to transfer your NFTs out, the likelihood of those NFTs being transferred out by someone else is incredibly low.
a Guardian can be anyone/anything you trust. Some examples include your email, your number, a friend or family member you trust, your L*dger wallet, your M*tam*sk wallet, etc.

so what makes @argentHQ's Argent Vault one of the most secure places to store your high-value NFTs? 

Guardians. Your JPEGs aren't moving out of your wallet unless it is approved by your Guardians.

lastly the latest thing I added was activating my Argent Vault

Argent uses Guardians, which can be people you trust, your contact info, and other wallets you may have, to approve actions

Nothing goes out of this until the majority or all of your Guardians approve the action. https://t.co/mIz602YVb5

hardware wallets are kept offline. safer than a hot wallet, but are still a single point of failure

i bought a l*dger to connect use with w*lletconnect/m*tam*sk for token-gated sites i trust and to act as a "guardian", basically to get best of both worlds https://t.co/999B2V3OrT

if you're familiar with 2FA and authenticator apps, security keys are basically the physical version of it.

2FA via SMS is the weakest, apps are stronger but rely on you never losing your device, and the physical key is the strongest just because the hacker would NEED it https://t.co/S96BGxXsKS

been super curious about digital security lately thanks to someone in the coven, esp w/ my digital accounts + crypto assets

in short, the easiest ways to massively upgrade your security is getting a:
- security key (physical 2FA)
- hardware wallet
- argent wallet

People love supporting people they know and care about in any way possible. 

Take the time to be a part of the community (genuinely, so do this with one you truly vibe with).

I know itâ€™s exciting to share what youâ€™ve been working on, and it can be difficult to get the word out.

But it can come off as youâ€™re only here to promote. Like, that youâ€™re not interested in being part of the community at all.
